# Ziva - AI Agent for Godot

Ziva is an autonomous AI development assistant for Godot Engine that writes, tests, and fixes code automatically.

## Key Information

- **What it does**: AI agent built into Godot that creates scenes, writes scripts, and fixes bugs autonomously
- **How it works**: Natural language commands → creates/modifies Godot projects → tests and verifies
- **Pricing**: 20 free credits, then $20 for more
- **Requirements**: Godot 4.2+, Windows/macOS/Linux
- **Status**: Active beta (v0.1.0)

## Main Resources

- README: https://github.com/ziva-sh/ziva-agent-plugin-godot/blob/main/README.md
- Website: https://ziva.sh
- Download: https://ziva.sh/download
- Support: GitHub Issues or Discord

## Key Features

- Autonomous task completion (multi-step features from start to finish)
- Automatic error detection and fixing
- Deep Godot integration (scenes, nodes, scripts, properties)
- Real-time debugging feedback
- Built-in side panel (no external tools)

## How Users Get Started

1. Download installer from ziva.sh/download
2. Run installer and select Godot project
3. Enable plugin in Project Settings
4. Sign in and start chatting with Ziva

## Differentiation

Unlike other Godot AI tools, Ziva autonomously completes tasks end-to-end and verifies code actually works by running scenes and checking for errors.
